title: Deloitte beats bidders into shape for Crescent's panels
text:
Australian buyout firm Crescent Capital has tapped Deloitte Corporate Finance in Sydney to help find a buyer for interior decorative panels business New Zealand Panels Group.

It is understood Deloitte has started warming up industry and private equity types, giving them a sneak peak at the business ahead of an auction which is slated to launch shortly.

Crescent Capital's advisers at Deloitte in Sydney have started briefing prospective acquirers of NZ Panels. Photo: Louie Douvis

Sources said NZ Panels would be pitched with more than $NZ100 million ($93 million) revenue and $NZ15 million to $NZ20 million in earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation.

It's expected to attract interest from global trade names including Europeans Kronospan and Broadview Holding, Aica Kogyo Company from Japan and Wilsonart and Mohawk Industries in the United States. There's also a handful of potential domestic trade players, as well as the local private equity set who are likely to at least take a look.

The big question is whether Deloitte’s dealmakers can get the offshore names to commit the time required to understand a $100 million-odd-a-year business located in New Zealand – and take on the locals.
description: Crescent has tapped Deloitte Corporate Finance to help find a buyer for interior decorative panels business NZ Panels.
